creator: sitongia@ucar.edu
text:
Using Cocoon 2.1.  Linux RH 8.  Java 1.4.1. 
 
Latest CVS build results in: 
 
compile: 
    [javac] Compiling 253 source files to /usr/local/lenya/src/lenya/build/lenya/classes 
    [javac] 
/usr/local/lenya/src/lenya/build/lenya/src/org/apache/lenya/cms/cocoon/acting/TaskAction.java:67: 
package org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.task does not exist 
    [javac] import org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.task.CocoonTaskWrapper; 
    [javac]                                         ^ 
    [javac] 
/usr/local/lenya/src/lenya/build/lenya/src/org/apache/lenya/cms/cocoon/acting/EditorSaveAction.java:84: 
org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting.EditorSaveAction should be declared abstract; it 
does not define isStringEncoded() in 
org.apache.cocoon.acting.AbstractValidatorAction 
    [javac] public class EditorSaveAction extends AbstractValidatorAction implements 
ThreadSafe { 
    [javac]        ^ 
    [javac] 
/usr/local/lenya/src/lenya/build/lenya/src/org/apache/lenya/cms/cocoon/acting/TaskAction.java:101: 
cannot resolve symbol 
    [javac] symbol  : class CocoonTaskWrapper 
    [javac] location: class org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting.TaskAction 
    [javac]         TaskWrapper wrapper = new CocoonTaskWrapper(objectModel, 
parameters); 
    [javac]                                   ^ 
    [javac] 3 errors

creator: sitongia@ucar.edu
text:
I switched over to the sources for Cocoon 2.1-M1 (from 2.1 CVS), and removed the 
Lenya build directory in order to start over, and I no longer get this error message.
